name: Hotel du Vin York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for business and was very pleased with the experience.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel - Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arriving, the staff were very welcoming and could not have been more friendly or helpful.
reviews.title: Fantastic room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: I stayed in the Brown Brothers room which is not massive but very well laid out and has everything you could need including a mini bar, nespresso machine, kettle etc, TV and DVD player. The bathroom, again, is not huge but really well done and very clean with nice soaps etc provided.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel to explore York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Room service is the same as the full bistro menu which was delicious.
reviews.title: Difficult to fault

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel say they have very limited parking but I had no trouble at all.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an amazing hotel - my second stay in a Du Vin hotel and I can't wait to try out the rest. We stayed in a standard double room, but it was luxurious. We even had a little balcony from where you can enjoy the sunshine. The toiletries are lovely and massive and they even encourage you to take them home with you. The room has some good extras such as a well stocked mini bar and dressing gowns. We ate in the Bistro one night, the food was delicious and the service 1st class. The hotel is a 5 minute walk to Migglegate and a further 5/10 minutes into town. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a luxury hotel in York.
reviews.title: Amazing stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic hotel in great location with deliberate attention to detail successful in almost every way. Lovely public areas; bar, restaurant, gardens, etc. I booked a deluxe room 5 days in advance and got a great rate (£125 inc. breakfast) and boy was it a deluxe room! Very, very spacious with an oversize bed, quality furniture, casual seating, roll-top bath and separate wet-room shower complete with robes and toiletries. Fantastic! Only downside was the flat screen TV - small (especially bearing in mind the size of the room) and not wall-mounted! The other negative I have is the below-average breakfast waitress service; not very attentive and when food arrived it did not match what was ordered.
reviews.title: Almost perfect......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were very pleased with our stay at the Hotel du Vin in York. Our room was on the parking lot side of the hotel, which is kind of made out like a garden, so it is nice to look at. Very calm. Room in perfect state (maybe recently refurbished?) and bathroom, too. Only little setback to the shower is if you measure more than a 1m85, you will not be able to stand under it and shower comfortably., but otherwise it is one of those large shower heads and feels like rain falling. Friendly and helpful personnel. Child friendly hotel.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights in April 2009 and was not disappointed. The hotel public areas were very modern and had been decorated to a high standard. Our bedroom and bathroom was also done in a very cosmopolitan way and it had one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. Our rate was also exceptional value for money and included breakfast and dinner which was served by wonderful staff in a pleasant environment. The hotel is ideally situated with a good sized car park and is only a short walk to the York races or into the centre of York for some fantastic shopping or a historic treat. Hotel Du Vin had wonderful little extras such as a selection of magazines in your room, fresh filter coffee and above all fresh milk. A brilliant hotel to stay in if you are in York, we would definitely return.
reviews.title: Brilliant short break in York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel du Vin York was the perfect hotel for our two night birthday stay. It was well located and was delightful from the moment we first entered. Everything looks stunning - really stylish but not the marble floored large chain look. Being an old buidling, the layout is quirky which is nice. We loved the Hartenberg room which was at the back of the main building so we could sleep with the window open - it had its own staircase. It was generously sized and we were in no hurry to leave it. It had a lovely wooden sleigh syle bed, great bath and walk in shower and the toiletries were particularly nice. We had both our dinners in the restaurant which is unusual for us but the food was so good. This hotel has very well trained staff who are helpful and very pleasant. We will try and stay in the other hotels in this small group.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have just returned after a wonderful relaxing stay in York. All of the staff OUTSTANDING, from the moment we arrived they couldn't have been more attentive. When we first arrived, Laura the manager at reception looked after us until the moment we left, bending over backwards to make sure we enjoyed ourselves. We originally booked for two nights which turned into six; we just didn’t want to leave. York is such a wonderful city. We left planning a return visit as we hadn't managed to fit everything in which we wanted to see and do. The hotel it's self is only a couple of minutes walk to the city centre; it couldn't have been placed in a better position to see all York has to offer. The bedrooms were to die for, with the most impressive bathrooms and facilities. We even had the pleasure of meeting David the General Manager who was wonderful, all his focus was on making our stay faultless. Thanks David you run an incredibly tight ship.
reviews.title: OUTSTANDING

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If you are wanting to stay in and around York for any occasion, don't book anywhere else Hotel Du Vin York is 'Faultless'.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel mins from Micklegate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once again, thank you all. We will be back as soon as we get a chance.
reviews.title: Excellent, friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Found this hotel by doing a random search. Rang them and got a good Sunday night offer. Hotel easy enough to find in York centre - plenty of parking - £10 per day. This used to be an orphanage and is truly lovely inside. Lots of little nooks and crannies (we never went to reception the same way twice!!). Our room was simply quite beautiful - it overlooked the back of the building. Two big windows with both drapes and blinds. Huge Kingsize bed with good quality linen (John Lewis I believe). Massive bathroom with overhead power shower (not good if you dont want to get your hair wet though! The best bit was the bath actually in our room. This was on a boarded area and lifted by railway sleepers - amazing. Food was really good, particularly the breakfast with some of the best choices I have seen (proper honeycomb too). Wine a tad on the expensive side but to be expected. The whole place had a serenity about it. Staff very helpful and friendly. A few minutes walk from the hotel gets you to Micklegate where you can climb on to the walls. There are a few restaurants and pubs in this area too. We ate once in the hotel and once within a few mins walk (see my review on Brigantes Bistro and bar).
reviews.title: Amazing stay and meal for my 30th birthday!!!
Reflects high standards of HdV chain - great place to stay
reviews.text: Had a great break in great surroundings. I would have given this a 5 star but for the fact that the pipes were very noisy when a nearby room filled their bath up!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Du Vin group is the best in England and this is the jewel in the Crown.A stylish,elegant hotel with beautiful beds and good toiletries that you are told to take! The restaurant is very popular so book a table.It has a stunning wine list with some real gems at retail prices.My favourite hotel outside London.
reviews.title: By far the best hotel in the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for our mini-moon after our wedding- so has lovely memories for us.
reviews.title: lovely stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: We'd booked a standard room and it was spacious and classy-def one of the best 4* hotels we've stayed in. The roomservice and general service was fantastic; they even included a free glass of champagne at dinner for us.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 10 minute walk into town
reviews.title: Great hotel, shame about the restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are truly unique, you do expect that with Hotel Du Vin and the price does reflect it. Free standing bath in the bathroom, massive shower. Heated floor, two sinks.
reviews.title: Fabulous find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first stay in a Hotel du Vin, this hotel provided a wonderful home for two days on a recent visit to the city of York. Very close to Micklegate and a short walk to the station it is well postioned for exploring York. Although it is situated on one of the main roads into York, our room and the hotel generally was very quiet. Our room was very well appointed, comfortable and very spacious. Excellent storage for clothes often forgotten by designers in many hotels. Coffee and tea maker, fresh milk in the fridge was a nice touch. Iron and ironing board, safe, hair drier, bathrobes, good selection of magazines. The bathroom had his and her sinks, a beautiful free standing bath and a very large walk in shower. Breakfast was good. The staff were very helpful and service very good. We will stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent city hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Back for 3rd visit and can't wait til 4th!! Wonderful service, reception staff were, as usual, extremely friendly and helpful. Restaurant food excellent and very attentive waiting staff. Still love our trips to York and Hotel du Vin 'I'll be back!!'
reviews.title: Back again!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: Hotel Du Vin is a fantastic base to explore York. The hotel is conveniently located approximately ten minutes walk from the centre of York. The hotel had lots of special little touches which made our stay very comfortable and the staff made us feel very welcome. The quality of food is excellent. I would thoroughly recommend the Bistro for lunch or dinner. Overall, a fantastic (and luxurious) base to explore the romantic and historic city of York.
reviews.title: Top notch!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: stayed over here after a family anniversary party. The accommodation, staff, service in our dining room and food were very good indeed from start to finish, it was just what we expected from this brand.
reviews.title: du vin at its best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh and by the way they now have Nespresso coffee machines (if you've never tried one they are the best!) in their rooms.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel with one or two niggles.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a night here for my husband's birthday. It was really nice. We stayed on an offer where you spend at least £75 in the restaurant - v easy to do - then got a room from £25. Having read the other helpful reviews on here about the standard rooms being quite small and because it was his birthday and because due to the offer it was only an extra £10 to upgrade we did. I'm so glad as hubby was v impressed. We were led up a gorgeous staircase to a lovely room at the front of the house. I would say quite masculine. Dark blue and black paper on a feature wall, very spacious and an awesome bathroom with claw footed bath and huge rainfall shower. Happy campers!
reviews.title: Really nice, recommended, just not the best hotel du vin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant and the meal in it was lovely - never had a bad HdV meal. Spinach soup was the best I've ever had and the chocolate pot mini dessert was awesome.
reviews.title: Excellent service in a high spec and relaxing environment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: There were a couple of slight downers.
reviews.title: Thumbs Up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When reserving online I had asked in the comment box if on our arrival reception would pls say happy birthday to my husband (as he was only going to see me that day so nice for him to hear a second happy birthday). When I got an email from Reception the day before our arrival (nice touch) I reminded them. They didn't. Instead they quite indiscreetly -had I not wanted him to know it was an offer - tried to kind of whisper to me asking if they could talk about the deal given they knew it was a birthday visit. Nice of them to think of that but not brilliantly executed, though that didn't matter all. But it showed they got my messages asking for a happy birthday to be said and didn't do it. A disappointing start. We checked we could leave the car in front of the building for a minute while we checked in and got told yes but then a minute later another staff member really aggressively told him to move it. The only other thing is that the bar was underwhelming. One room was tiny, overlit and not v stylish while the other is an undercover courtyard area - with a nice sofa inbetween the two. It was fine, it's just that we love smart bars and we regularly drink in the Harrogate HdV which has a lovely big bar and the Cheltenham one we visited was beautiful too. This was a let down but they obviously have to work with the space they have. Also the bar was v quiet but our two cocktails still took a full 15 minutes to arrive.
reviews.title: Best hotel experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012
reviews.text: So I can't quite rave about it but it is lovely. And an easy ten min walk to town - perfect location for a york city break. Would certainly recommend, it was a great treat.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: A classy choice - I loved my room, with its huge open plan bathroom, roll-top bath and walk in monsoon shower. Well worth it for the quality of the beds and bedding alone.
reviews.title: Great rooms - lovely beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is great too - but its main let-down is service. Needs more staff in almost every area. Reception check-out was slow and flustered with a big queue. Dinner service was ungracious and inattentive, despite insisting it was impossible to have our table 20 minutes earlier than booked (Lots of empty tables) - because the kitchen wouldn't be able to cope. More like the restaurant staff wouldn't be able to cope!
reviews.title: ok, but !
Great Find - Highly recommended
reviews.text: Anyway - it wouldn't stop me going back (I have a stay booked later this week in fact), and if the service is better i'd rate it 5.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked a "Lazy Sunday" break and our room was in an annex next to the hotel. The cost for the night was £169 DB&B. (Normally £149 but because its Valentines weekend we had to pay £169)
reviews.title: Tasteful hotel in a good location
*****5 Star*****
reviews.text: The staff on arrival were lovely and very professional, the room was very hot, small but nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in the hotel for a short break last week. The location is fantastic, the hotel looks amazing and the staff very friendly and welcoming. We have previously stayed at the grange and hilton, however the Hotel du Vin has the edge.
reviews.title: The best hotel in York

likes.liked: — I am told that dos are welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Moet suite, with twin roll top baths and a ten foot bed! we did not want to leave.
reviews.title: Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bistro was friendly and relaxed serving a range of quality food hat was worthy of the money.
reviews.title: Do the Du Vin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have seen on the website there is now a dinner bed and breakfast rate which is something I would go back for.
reviews.title: A Real Luxury Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks for a great weekend,
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

likes.disliked: — Small blood stain on curtain, restaurant staff were a bit miserable

description: Hotel du Vin & Bistro York is located in the tranquil area known as The Mount, close to the city's historic centre. This beautiful hotel in York city centre is housed within a Grade II-listed building that dates back to the early 19th century. Formerly a private home and an orphanage, the hotel houses 44 stylish bedrooms and suites, trademark bistro, bar and private dining rooms, along with a terrace, courtyard and inner forum for alfresco dining. York is a historic and beautiful city, believed to date back from Roman times. York is the county town of Yorkshire, perfect for a cultural getaway or a romantic weekend break that will inspire.
